name: Easy Healthy Pie Crust (Vegan/Gluten Free/Oil Free)
description: This is the most amazing healthy pie crust in the world, and it's foolproof! Perfect for sweet & savory pies or vegan quiche. Vegan/Gluten Free/Oil Free!
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup gluten free all purpose flour*
1 tablespoon granulated sugar ((leave out for savory pies))

recipeInstructions.text: Make the flax egg by combining the ground flax and water together in a small bowl. Stir and set aside for 5 minutes, until it thickens. If pre-baking the crust, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F at this time.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the flax egg by combining the ground flax and water together in a small bowl. Stir and set aside for 5 minutes, until it thickens. If pre-baking the crust, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F at this time.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, add the almond flour, gluten free flour, sugar (leave out for savory pies) and salt. Stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, add the almond flour, gluten free flour, sugar (leave out for savory pies) and salt. Stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: To the bowl with the dry ingredients, add the thickened flax egg mixture and 4 tablespoons of additional water. Stir well with a large spoon until the dough comes together. Add an additional 1-2 tablespoons more water as needed. The dough is ready when you can squeeze it in your hands and it doesn't crumble; it should be moist but not too wet.
recipeInstructions.name: To the bowl with the dry ingredients, add the thickened flax egg mixture and 4 tablespoons of additional water. Stir well with a large spoon until the dough comes together. Add an additional 1-2 tablespoons more water as needed. The dough is ready when you can squeeze it in your hands and it doesn't crumble; it should be moist but not too wet.

recipeInstructions.text: Form the dough into a cohesive ball with your hands. If it's too wet, add a little more gluten free flour.
recipeInstructions.name: Form the dough into a cohesive ball with your hands. If it's too wet, add a little more gluten free flour.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the ball of dough on a large piece of parchment paper or other clean surface sprinkled with gluten free flour to prevent sticking. Flatten the dough with your hands, sprinkle with flour, then use a rolling pin to roll it into an even circle about 12 inches in diameter.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the ball of dough on a large piece of parchment paper or other clean surface sprinkled with gluten free flour to prevent sticking. Flatten the dough with your hands, sprinkle with flour, then use a rolling pin to roll it into an even circle about 12 inches in diameter.

recipeInstructions.text: Use the parchment paper or rolling pin to carefully place the dough into your 9 inch pie plate. It's okay if it's not perfect. Gently press the dough into the pie plate and patch any tears with excess dough from the edges. Flute the edges if desired.

recipeInstructions.text: With a fork, poke all over the bottom of the crust.
recipeInstructions.name: With a fork, poke all over the bottom of the crust.

itemListElement.text: For no-bake pies: Bake the crust at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes until golden brown. Let cool for 15-20 minutes before filling. No need to use pie weights, this pie crust will not shrink!
itemListElement.name: For no-bake pies: Bake the crust at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes until golden brown. Let cool for 15-20 minutes before filling. No need to use pie weights, this pie crust will not shrink!

itemListElement.text: For cooked pies: Pre-bake the crust for 10 minutes at 350 degrees F, then fill and bake as directed from whichever pie recipe you are using.
